title: ZTE Grand X3 Google account verification bypass problem due to TouchPal keyboard

thread.text:
Hi guys, I'm not too far behind the times when it comes to technology buti seem to have a real problem that I hope has a simple solution. My girlfriend ex began stalking her and used Google's device administrator to lock her phone and leave creepy messages... Lol... So she factory reset the phone not realizing Google would need her to verify her account. Since he hacked her email and she can't access her backup account i proceeded to bypass the account verification with one small hiccup... From the keyboard I need to access the settings but TouchPal didn't give you this option and I can't seem to figure out how to change the keyboard. Long pressing on a blank space didn't work and I can't access the phones settings or use the pulldown. Wtf? Anyone know the way to change the keyboard with it being in this locked state? Thanks.
Carrier: Cricket
Brand: ZTE
Model: Grand X3
Root: No
Issue: FRP Bypass using TouchPal 
Solutions Attempted: Long press, Settings from keyboard menu

Welcome to Android Central! Has your girlfriend already tried recovering her Google account? https://www.google.com/accounts/recovery/
Also, it may be worth contacting the proper authorities about her ex's activities. Hacking another person's email is a crime: Criminal Penalties for Email Hacking

The solution for your problem, I figured out today. It sounds like you know what to do if you can get the google keyboard back so I'll help you with that. Start fresh by restoring the device again. Now go to the wifi section. Type your wifi password and select advanced settings now make sure it's selected for manual with a proxy: privatoria.com and 3128 for port with dhcp still selected. Now connect. This will tell the phone it has wifi but it won't be able to communicate with google server. You notice that it keeps going to a screen that says can't connect but keep doing it and try to do it faster... it will take eventually.. I tried it on different wifi and a few times and it always skipped to the software update screen and then to passcode setup. At password setup select password..not passcode or passnumbers or pass swipping...words... choose something easy to remember. and then go through the whole process back to the main screen. Now press the power button and then back on. You are at a password screen, swip and now beside the password input form is a keyboard. Select it and select google keyboard. There ya go!!

title: ZTE Blade Z Max VS. Zmax Pro

thread.text:
I currently own the ZTE Zmax Pro. After intensive researching, I found out the Zmax Pro is better than the Blade Z Max, although it's older. Here are the pros and cons:
Blade Z Max
Pros:
- Bigger battery (4000 vs. 3400 mAh)
- Faster charging
- Dual camera effects (bokeh and monochrome)
- Android 7.1, slightly nicer, closer to stock Android
- Nicer looking design on the back
Cons:
- Slower Snapdragon 435 CPU vs. 617 on the Zmax Pro
- FM Radio not working or crashing
- Photo quality in low light is worse than the Zmax Pro
- Dual camera is supposedly fake and 2nd lens not actually useable
- Microphone quality is horrible, sounds very cheap compared to Zmax Pro (hear for yourself)
- Loud speaker is worse than Zmax Pro
- Cheap Chinese brand Asahi glass compared to Gorilla Glass 3 on Zmax Pro
Zmax Pro
Pros:
- Faster Snapdragon 617 cpu
- Better low-light performance compared to Blade Z Max
- Shutter speed control in manual mode (disabled on Blade Z Max)
- Microphone recording is very good
- Costs cheaper since it's last year's
Cons:
- Smaller battery
- UI looks older, not 100% stock Android but very close
- Back design looks very plain, an old design
- Slower charging (but still has Quick Charge 2.0)
Overall, the Blade Z Max has a bigger battery but a slightly slower processor and horrible low light camera and microphone. The Zmax Pro has a better low light camera and more manual controls for the camera. The microphone also sounds good on the Zmax Pro as well as the loudspeaker. If you're considering upgrading, you should consider these factors. Do you have the Blade Z Max? Let me know your thoughts. I've been thinking about buying it but after reaching, I'm having second thoughts. Seems like ZTE is trying to cut corners, the Zmax Pro was an awesome device at a very attractive price, definitely expecting a bit of an upgrade at least. Still love my Zmax Pro, it still rocks!

Still have my Zmax Pro as my backup phone. 
The Blade seems to get laggy according to some other forums. My Pro never gets laggy.
there's various issues with the blade zMAX hopefully ZTE can fix some of them but not everyone has the same issues with the exception of it being very laggy
my experience with the camera on the z max and the pro we're quite the opposite. the z max took much better photos than the pro in low light. and so far I've had no problems with lag.

title: ZTE Grand X 4 audio sync issue

thread.text:
Hello, I got a ZTE Grand X 4 yesterday and I was watching youtube videos on the app and I noticed that the audio was quite delayed. I watched videos on the web browser version on the X 4 and the sync was working fine. I was wondering how to fix this issue.
Thanks in advace!

Welcome to Android Central! Try going to Settings>Apps, select YouTube, then Storage, then Clear Cache/Clear Data. Does the problem persist?
Also, does it happen on both wi-fi and mobile data?
Thank you for responding, I tried clearing the cache and data, yet the problem still persists. And yes, this does happen on both wi-fi and mobile data.

If YouTube was preinstalled, see if this also happens in Safe Mode: How to turn on safe mode on Zte Grand X Max+
When you get a chance, head over to the Introductions forum and tell us something about yourself! http://forums.androidcentral.com/introductions/
This still happens in safe mode.

Is this with all videos, or just certain ones?
Sometimes Android System Webview can cause weird things to happen. Go to the Play Store, look for Android System Webview, and see if you have any updates. If so, update it. If not, try uninstalling updates, since sometimes it's the updates that cause the problems.
This happens with all videos, I uninstalled the updates and it still happens, I reinstalled the updates and it still happens.

One more thing to try is to uninstall any updates to the YouTube app (if you haven't tried that already). If the problem persists, then I'd guess it'a a problem with the phone's firmware. Not sure if there's an easy way to reinstall the firmware on that phone. Since the phone is new, I'd just bring it back to the store and ask for a replacement. Make sure you test it out in the store before going home with it.
Thank you very much for your help, I uninstalled youtube's updates and the audio is now in sync! Also, when you you recommend me to begin updating YouTube again?
Ok thank you for your efforts

YouTube gets updated pretty frequently, so take a look at the release date of the current version in the Play Store, then wait until that release date changes. Then try updating it again, and see if the problem persists.
Also, make sure to send feedback to Google about this problem through the Help & Feedback option in the YouTube app's settings. Google can't fix these things if they don't hear about them!
Are you using bluetooth? Does it also do it when you're using corded headphones? I'm pretty sure it's going to be your bluetooth that delaying things.

replies.text: It actually isn't compatible. We found that very few are however you can go to an electronics store OR Amazon (cheaper) and order Digi Yes microUSB wireless charging receiver module. They are leas then 10.00 looks almost like the sticker they put on someone before they shock their heart.
Micro USB? The Zmax Pro has USB c...

Not easily since the available universal Qi receiver require the USB port to be working but if you purchase a Qi wireless receiver DIY kit and pop open the back side of the z987 and then attach the Qi receiver directly to the positive and negative terminals of the battery connector in the z987 and then attache the coil facing up to the battery using double sided tape reassemble making sure not to crimp any of the wires between the backside cover of the z987 then place the Z987 back side down on the Qi wireless charger pad you should be all set provided you connected the terminals correctly you should hear that tell tail clicking sound that you used to hear when your USB port was still working when you plug the charger in

thread.text:
According to what I can find, the Max has no Qi charging pins, so the Qi receiver connects to the USB port.
Replacing the port shouldn't be that expensive - the connector is cheap, and a good tech can replace it pretty quickly.

Welcome to Android Central! Open Google Play Store and search for Android System Webview--is it up to date?

What version of Android is it running? Try this:
1. Make sure Developer Options is turned on. If you don't see it in your System Settings, then go to Settings>About Phone, and tap Build Number 7 times. 
2. Go to Developer Options, and look for an option to toggle between NuPlayer and AwesomePlayer. If you find that option, toggle to the other selection.
I think NuPlayer vs AwesomePlayer is only on Lollipop devices, but it's still worth checking.

thread.text: I purchased my Grand X4 direct from the carrier so presumably it is not rooted. The phone decides whether to save app data to its internal storage or to the external storage (microSD). Most of the apps I've installed are saving to the microSD so I'm happy. I still have 6 GB of its 16 GB internal storage to spare. Everything we install from Google Play Store ideally would be stored automatically to the microSD but that's not the reality.
If you're really pushed for extra space, you can try formatting the SD card as an internal memory. But then you're stuck with your SD card forever.

I just got this phone 3 days ago second-hand for $45, including a case & the original quick charger.
Coming from an LG Stylo 2 and the ZTE Grand X Max 2, I think this may be my favorite. I liked the Stylo 2 except its GPS had tendencies to need more time than normal to "wake up" when I wanted to use Maps (I leave location services ON but set to "battery saving" until I need directions at which time I switch it to "HIGH") and sometimes I even had to reboot it or else the GPS would do nothing at all. The ZTE Grand X Max 2 didn't have that issue and its big-screen experience was something else, but it was a pocketful to say the least.
The Grand X4 feels like a ZTE Grand X Max 2 "downsized for sanity" if you will. Its 5.5" (with off-screen buttons) is to me the "sweet spot," 5" with on-screen buttons is just too small but 6" with off-screen buttons is HUGE. It reminds me a lot of the ZTE ZMax 2 GoPhone I had last year, it was also a 5.5" model with off-screen buttons and was a phone I felt that should've been updated to a ZTE ZMax 3 with Lollipop (and, coming up, a ZTE ZMax 4 with Nougat). You could say this is that phone (so long as you have Cricket, which I do).
Also, I've founds its battery life to be better than the ZTE Grand X Max 2 I had (although that one had perhaps been well-used) and its performance to be at least at the Stylo 2 level if not at the Grand X Max 2 level. I don't do hard-core gaming, but I can appreciate a phone that doesn't "studder" with everyday tasks, and I find it to run smoothly. I also like its usage of USB-C, I so appreciate the cord not being 1-way when you insert it. Also it seems to have the best signal strength, by a small margin, as I live in a rural area and it works probably the best of the 3 at home. Overall I say it's a solid device and I look forward to a Grand X5 with Nougat.

title: ZTE Grand Max 2 stuck on Cricket screen.

thread.text:
Hiya! My phone, an unrooted ZTE Grand Max 2 Z988 is having some trouble booting.
The phone has suffered no physical damage, so I can assure you it's not that.
I read somewhere that disabling a certain apps that come pre-downloaded might cause some issues, but I'm afraid I forget where I read that;;
For a week, I know Touchpal 2017, a default keyboard on the phone displayed ads. You would open Snapchat or something and an ad would play. Or there would be banners on top of the notification screen. Or there would be half a circle on the side of your screen, and if you pressed it, and ad would pop up. Of course being the sane human being I am, I disabled the app as much as I could (as much as an unrooted phone could, anyway). I uninstalled all the Touchpal updates and didn't let it auto-update. I don't know if this is the cause of the problem but I thought I should let you guys know anyway.
The problem is, I'll turn it on, and the ZTE and Cricket splash intros (is that what they're called?) will play, but the phone will stay stuck on the cricket screen. Before this problem occurred, the app I was using crashed. Then, the launcher I was using crashed (Nova Launcher). It would ask me to choose a default launcher and if you did, it would crash immediately after and ask again. So I rebooted the phone to try to fix the problem. Of course that only made the problem worse;;
Here's what I tried so far to fix the problem.
-Turn it on and off. I get as far as the cricket screen and that's it.
-Wiped the partition cache. From what I can tell the cache was cleared but it affected nothing. I'm still stuck on the cricket screen.
-Reboot from a bootloader. I have no idea what that means or does, but at that point I was getting desperate. It didn't do anything either;;
-Booted in safe mode. Or at least I think it's safe mode. All it shows is a gray box with the letters FTM in black times new roman. I couldn't do anything from there other than to reboot it again.
The most obvious solution is to factory reset, but there's photos and videos on there I really don't want to lose. I've tried connecting it to my PC but the PC doesn't recognize the device. If you don't know how to fix my phone, any way to recover my pictures and videos would be greatly appreciated. I tried to be as thorough as I could. If I left anything out, feel free to tell me.
Thanks!!

thread.text:

I can't turn the media volume up once the cord is plugged in. I can turn it down to get the Volume menu popped up. But it will not turn up, either via the volume key or sliding the bar across the screen. My phone simply locks itself, flashes my home screen background, and then the lockscreen shows up.
I did not have this issue last night in my own vehicle nor with the headphones I listened to music through last night.
Does this sound familiar to anyone, and does anyone know any sort of troubleshooting steps I could take to fix this? I've already tried restarting the phone and I powered it completely off and left it off for 5 minutes before powering it back up.
Welcome to Android Central! Was the same aux cable working fine before, or did you just start using the cable and noticed this behavior? Are you able to try a different aux cable?

replies.text:
I will be able to try one when I finish up at work. This aux cord worked yesterday and the cord in my own vehicle worked before I arrived at work.
If it helps, I have narrowed it down to the issue only occurring when I have a music app open, i.e. Spotify. When I am on the phone with the headphones connected, the volume keys work fine as expected.

thread.text: I've also noticed it's been clearing my home screen image. It'll do the blacking out and lock my phone, and then I unlock my phone to find the stock MetroPCS screen image as my background.
Is it only with Spotify? What about the stock Music app, or Google Play Music?
Stock app is affected as is YouTube
See if it happens in Safe Mode as well (which means you'll only be able to test with preinstalled apps, like the stock Music app). https://support.t-mobile.com/docs/DOC-27494

replies.text: Unfortunately that did not work. I did have a ZTE software update on Monday. Could that be affecting anything?

thread.text: That's very possible. If it's a bug in the update, you'll just have to report it to ZTE and hope they fix it in the next update.

I am having the exact same problem and have tried everything I can think of and it's still doing it.it just started this morning.it was working fine last night.if anyone knows how to fix it please help.

My phone is having the exact same issue. I'm inclined to believe it's not an issue with the update because mine was doing it before and it is still doing it after the update. If anyone has found out anything I'd really like to get some info it's very frustrating as it happens with headphones, aux cords, & even Bluetooth!

Finally after months of dealing with this hell I found a fix! I had to contact ZTE customer service. Here's the fix hope it helps. 
1 go to settings
2 go to Apps 
3 press the three dots in the upper right corner
4 select "Reset app preferences" 
5 press "show system "
6 scroll down to Bluetooth Share
7 press force stop
8 turn off device
9 hold the power and volume up key until the phone lights up
10 release ONLY THE POWER BUTTON
You'll get the screen you'd get if you were doing a factory reset. 
11 with the volume down button select "wipe cache partion" use the power key to select it. 
12 then select reboot phone
Once it turns on the problem should be fixed! Hope this helps.

title: Grand X Max 2 bluetooth and notification screen staying lit fixes

thread.text:
So after looking at a lot of reviews and being very on the fence about it, I went out and bought a grand x max 2 earlier this week. I noticed right away 2 issues that others also claimed to have and saw no fixes online. I have found a fix, or really more of a work around for these two issues, and wanted to share.
The first issue I noticed was the bluetooth chopping badly and playing back at faster speed and being almost inaudible in my car. After about 15 seconds of this my car would actually disconnect from the phone. I noticed in my driveway, where I could still pick up wifi, it played and worked fine. As soon as I got about 3 houses down and lost wifi and the phone switched to 4g the bluetooth would start cutting out and chopping badly. After trying a ton of settings, renaming the phone, deleting and setting the phone back up with my car, etc. I finally found what seems to be a fix. All I had to do was TURN OFF WIFI when I am not actually connected to wifi. As soon as I turn off wifi the bluetooth works perfectly and actually sounds great. With iheartradio in my Ford Focus with 'Sync' it sounds clearer and much better than my galaxy s5 and iphone 5s did. My wife told me when the phone switched during a phone call getting into my car that I acutally sounded clearer and louder when the car's bluetooth took over the call. When I want to connect to wifi I can turn it back on and bluetooth still works fine as long as I have a wifi signal. So for my phone at least, the problem seems to be using the network data with wifi turned on. I'm curious to see if this cures other peoples woes too.
The second problem I noticed was when I would get a group text or picture (any mms message) the phone would wake to the notification screen and would stay lit until I hit the power button to go back to sleep. It would stay lit for hours at a time. The work around I found was to ditch the stock messaging app and download google messenger (which I prefer anyway). Setting google messenger to the default messaging app fixed the issue for me, now the screen only stays lit for the set 15 seconds. I haven't noticed any issue with instagram or snapchat notifications. I haven't downloaded facebook to this phone yet so not sure about that one. I'm holding out as long as I can because the app is so invasive.
I hope this helps. So far after fixing those two annoyances I am very happy with the phone. For $150, it is impressive and a good step above my most recent phone, a Galaxy S5.

Welcome to Android Central, and thanks for the tips! I've seen that solution for the Bluetooth issue as well.
When you get a chance, head over to the Introductions forum and tell us something about yourself! Introductions - Android Forums at AndroidCentral.com

2 days in update, still no issues with my bluetooth or notifications. It looks like this is a fix for me. I still wish bluetooth would work without toggling wifi, but I'll live with that for a good value phone.
Battery life is surprising on this phone too for the size of the screen and processor. I am not a heavy user, but I have 3 hr 55 min of screen on time, and stream music every morning and I haven't charged the phone since the full charge I put on it the day I got it. So at 2pm today I will be at two full days without charging and I am just now at 17%.

title: WiFi keeps turning on without permission

thread.text:
Hello,
We recently got a ZTE Cymbal Z353VL phone. This is a "hybrid" flip/Android phone running Lollipop 5.1 on Tracfone's Verizon-based network.
As we have a limited WiFi at home, we do not want the WiFi on the phone to connect - yet it turns itself on each day - various times - without "permission". Not that I've noticed - but we also do not want it connecting to any public WiFi on its own!
How can I check what is causing this. WiFi is set to OFF and so far no apps have been downloaded. It does have something called WiFi Utility - does anyone know what that is or does? Might that be somewhere to check?
I want to be able to turn the WiFi on and off myself - not have it automatically turn on and connect.
Any help is appreciated.
Thanks!
LH
Go to Settings>Wi-fi, tap Menu>Advanced, and look for a Wi-fi Scanning option. Turn that off. It might be in Settings>Location instead, if you tap the Menu button there.

Thanks for the reply. I did look more into the "WiFi Utility" on the phone and found that it had three settings - one choice was to turn that feature off. It was set to always find and connect to secure networks to "save data charges" - so I think that was why it was turning itself on. I chose the Never Connect option, but I can still connect manually, so hopefully that has solved it!
Thanks again for the help!
LH

title: A more secure browser recommendation?

thread.text:
Hey guys, I'm a user of a ZTE assurance wireless phone. I had this phone for a week and it's my first android phone, so mobile wise, I'm quite new to web browsing. While I was using chrome, a webpage redirected me to a pop up saying I was infected, of course I avoided it. Tried hitting the back button many times, but then I decided to hit the menu button as fast as I could to close down the browser. Luckily it was on incognito, so hopefully it didn't leave anything bad behind.
I know androids are not known to get viruses, but I totally forgot about the redirects/pop up issues that can occur when I decided to browse. I had used AVG, Malwarebytes and even my purchased copy of Kaspersky(with subscription code) from google play store and their scans came up all clean. I still can't help but worry though. Should I factory reset my phone anyway? Also, what apps or browsers do you guys recommend to prevent this from happening again?

Factory reset is an act of desperation and is an arduous process to set the device up again. 
I wouldn't stress about a couple of popups, they are adware,, they want to sell you their "anti malware product" also called scare ware. If it persists, an adblocker may be the go. I have adguard here, zero ads, zero popups and it has a great firewall that blocks all internet access from any app! In any case, if you get a pop up, don't click on ANY part of it, just back out with the home key and go again with browser... In order to get any bugs, you have to agree to download stuff or open attachments or sideload apps.

I have had good luck using McAfee Web Advisor chrome extension. It warns me if the website I click on is known to have risky behaviors, and asks if I want to assume the risk or go back.
I use the ghostery chrome extension on my laptop computer. It blocks trackers. Haven't tried it on my phone.
When Mcafee, Malwarebytes, Spybot Search and Destroy don't catch the redirects malware on my laptop, I use SpyHunter 4. It catches stuff that Malwarebytes misses. Its parent, Enigma Software Group, has a mixed reputation in security circles, but I find SpyHunter 4 is very effective and has not introduced anything negative onto my laptop. Again, I have not tried to use it on my ZTE Android phone.
I wouldn't worry about it. It's just an ad to sell you virus protection. Just shut down the page and resume your browsing. An ad blocking app is your best bet.

title: Storage on my t815

thread.text:
Trying to work out how to store more stuff to the SD card so that i can update apps 
I have deleted so much stuff. I dont even have my fave apps (messenger insta and candy crush) anymore as insufficient storage! Im so sick of this message lol
I can't find where to change the storage settings on the camera (to save my pics directly to the SD card)??
Thank you in advanced

Some camera apps can't change the location.
More and more apps can't be moved (it depends on how they're written). And if you formatted the SD card as adoptible (or internal) storage, there's no "external" card to move anything to - the card becomes part of internal storage.

Open your Camera app and look through its settings menu. If there's no option to change the default storage location for photos, then you can't change it to the SD card.
See this guide for tips on how to maximize your internal storage: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...-warnings.html

title: ZTE Grand X Max Plus videos skipping at start

thread.text: Ok hey everybody I have a ZTE Grand X Max Plus from Cricket and when I first got it I didn't have this issue, but since I've had it I've updated from Android 4.X.X (can't remember) to 5.1.1 now I can't remember if it did this when I first updated but every time I play an online video whether it be YouTube or a Facebook video they skip for around 5-10 seconds EVERY SINGLE TIME is there any fix for this I can't find anything it used to never do it and now it does it constantly

Welcome to Android Central! First, activate your Developer Options by going to Settings>About Phone and tapping Build Number 7 times. Now go to the Developer Options and see if there is an option to toggle between NuPlayer and AwesomePlayer. If you see it, try toggling to whatever is not currently selected.
Another thing to do is to see if your Android System Webview app is up to date in the Play Store.

Thanks for responding and thanks for the welcome! I've scanned through my developer settings but I don't see anything related to video settings sadly...I at one time Got an update for something about WebView that had a gear as the app icon which I did install that may have been when this started but I honestly can't remember.

Sometimes, updates to Android System Webview can themselves cause problems. Go to the Play Store, and search for Android System Webview. If it says Update, then update it. If it's already updated, then try uninstalling updates.

title: ZMax Pro charging yet showing battery at 77% and falling, but icon on the top left shows 100%

thread.text:
Just started this morning. Plugged it in to charger when I got in to work, and it stays on the charger all day, only off if I get up for a 15 minute break or a 30 minute lunch. 
Naturally batter is always showing full at 100% or close to that if near the end of lunch after watching Netflix during lunch. 
Today, it showed down to 65% after just having been unplugged from a 4 hour charge. It charged up to show 77% then the little lightning bolt on the batter disappeared and on the top left of the screen was the little "full battery" icon telling you the charge was full and to disconnect the charger. Four inches to the right on the top right of the screen, the battery shows 76%.
I tried restarting the phone, but it's still the same. 
So is it fully charged as it should be? Or is the battery or the phone crapping out on me?

Welcome to Android Central! Try recalibrating the battery sensor software by charging up to 100% (if possible), then using the phone normally until it shuts down from low battery. Then charge up again to 100%. You might have to repeat this cycle a couple of times.

How to unlock this phone:
1. Do not turn the phone on, don't even open the box.
2. Go to this web site: https://www.att.com/deviceunlock/#/
3. Check I have read and agree to the eligibility requirements to unlock my device.
4. This is super important, check Non-AT&T Mobility Customer
5. Fill out the form, including the IMEI number which is located on the Box

7. You will be sent an email with a link to confirm
8. Open your email and confirm
9. Anywhere from 1 hour to 48 hours you will be given an unlock code. It took 29 hours for me to receive mine.
10. Open up the box, put in your SIM from your Carrier and turn it on.
11. You will be prompted for the unlock code
12. Put it in and continue.

title: ZTE won't save apps to SD card

thread.text:
I've looked around and this seems to be a common topic, though I haven't seen anyone else having the specific issues I am having, nor any info for this kind of problem with my particular phone. 
I have a ZTE Avid Plus Z828 from T-Mobile, running Android version 5.1.1 
8GB Internal Storage, 788MB Available, 4.47GB System memory, 2.76GB Used space
14.91GB SD card, 14.12GB Available 
I have two options for the Save Location under storage settings, Phone and SD card. I have selected the SD card as the save location, but nothing I download will actually save there. It all goes to the phone's internal storage, and while I can still manually move apps to the SD card, I can't download anything that is larger than the available internal storage space. Additionally, I frequently get the insufficient storage notification when I try to download apps, even when their download is size significantly smaller than the space available on the internal storage. For instance, when I try to download the game Dungeon Hunter 3, which has a download size of only 471MB, it tells me I have insufficient storage, even though it says I have 788MB available.
I know the SD card is installed properly since I can move apps to it and it has music saved on it. I've only downloaded a few apps and I've moved all of them to the SD card. I have no movies or music stored internally, and I've deleted all but 10 of the pics saved to my phone. The SD card is not locked and does not have any secure storage. I've cleared the cached data multiple times and I've gone into the file manager and deleted a bunch of ad videos and images that other apps had saved to my phone. And yes, I have tried turning it off and on again. Many times. XD 
I've seen some people talking about "rooting" in various posts about memory problems, but I have no idea what that is and am very new to Android devices..
Two other, somewhat related problems are that any time a downloaded app updates, it moves itself back to the phone and I have to go in and move it back to the SD card. replies.text: Welcome to Android Central!The Save Location is for downloading discrete files (like photos or document files)--not for installing apps. Apps always have to download and install to Internal Storage first, after which the user can try to move a portion of the app to the SD card (if the device supports moving the app--and not all devices support this).Keep in mind that the download size shown in Google Play Store is only the size of the installer file. The full app usually requires substantially more internal storage (just like a Windows program's final size on the hard drive is significantly larger than the EXE file). And there is also a threshold available space below which the system prevents you from installing anything (since the system always has to make sure a certain amount of storage is available for various system apps as well).Rooting a phone is the process of obtaining superuser status, allowing you to have more control over the system. It can give the user much more power, but it's also not for beginners, since doing the wrong thing can brick the phone. Also, in your situation, the main way that rooting would help would be if the phone didn't support moving apps to SD in the first place, because then you could use apps like Link2SD or App Mgr III (which require root).This is normal behavior.This is not normal behavior. Are you completely powering down the phone, or only putting the screen to sleep?
Thanks for the reply!Powering down the phone. When I put the screen to sleep, the icons stay put.

title: How do I get my ZTE Paragon to use the microSD card for storage?

thread.text:
From what I've read online & in the user manual, the ZTE Paragon Z753G supposedly has 4GB storage. But mine is only showing 1.27GB total storage with currently 319MB available. I had to delete the only 3 apps that I had downloaded because the "available" storage had dropped to 104MB and when I tried to used one app, it froze up and I received a message that my storage was full so I would no longer receive SMS messages. Even when I'm showing 200+MB available, attempting to download & install an app that uses 30MB results in failure to install due to lack of space. It seems the Android system & pre-installed Google apps (which apparently can't be uninstalled) take up nearly all the storage space.
I've installed a 32GB microSD card, but the only thing that goes there automatically are pics/videos I take. How do I make my phone utilize the micro SD card for storage so that I can actually install & use apps??

Welcome to Android Central! This is the major problem with budget phones that come with only 4 GB of internal storage (which, IMHO, should be outlawed  ). The 4 GB is the total amount of storage the phone comes with, but about 3 GB of that has to be taken up by the OS (as well as any bloatware). So you're not left with much to work with.
Not all phones support moving apps to SD (and those that do can only move a portion of an app to the SD, not the whole thing). Apps still have to be downloaded and installed to Internal Storage first, before moving to SD, so if you're low on storage, you may not be able to install the app in the first place.
See this guide: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...-warnings.html

title: How do you move apps to sd card on ZTE Obsidian Metro PCS phone?

thread.text: tried getting apps from play store to move apps to sd card but they don't work or they say that apps can't be moved on this phone. Any way around it? if not whats sd card slot for?

No way around it - but not because of the phone. Some apps just won't run from the card (widgets won't, for example). If the developer knows that his app won't run from a card he writes code to disable the "Move" button, because the app won't work if it's moved, and because people will email him complaining that it doesn't.
The ones that get moved but don't work are the ones developed by people who don't know to check whether their app will run from a card.
(It's the way Android works - some apps just won't run from the card. If you must have your apps running from the card, root and run External 2 Internal SD (Root) - it swaps the internal and external storage, so if you have, say 4GB of internal storage and a 32GB card, you now have 32GB of "internal" storage and a 4GB "card".)

I got ZTE Obsidian from Tmobile. This model also doesn't allow move app to SD.
However, it was possible to go around by rooting it.
I used KingRoot for rooting the device. Just installed it and run it.
Then, AParted for partitioning the SD card. I resized current FAT partion and
created new additional partion with EXT4 file system. after formating and rebooting,
the two file system on SD worked fine.
Then I used Apps2SD to move (actually link) app onto new SD partition.
For binding or linking folder, FolderMount [ROOT] worked fine.
I have other ZTE phone and will try it later. hope this help.

title: Please Help: SD card problem

thread.text: SD card is blank or have unsupported files

Welcome to Android Central! The SD card could be corrupt, defective, or counterfeit. Install SD Insight to see if the card is genuine or counterfeit. Counterfeit cards are programmed to report more storage than they actually have, and if you try saving more than the card can actually hold, then files can start getting corrupt.
If it's a valid card, then go to Settings>Storage, Unmount the card, remove it, and insert it into your computer. Can the computer read these files? Backup as much as you can right now, then run chkdsk to look for bad sectors: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...d-sd-card.html.

title: Slide/Tap/Gesture to wake up screen on ZTE DUO MAX w/ Nova Prime

thread.text:
Hi everyone,
I recently got a new ZTE DUO MAX LTE phone from Straight Talk running on Verizon. Long story short, I had a (absolutely amazing) THL 5000 running on At&t on ST that killed itself in my dog's water bowl. I LOVED the THL5000, and my AT&T service was great where I am renting to live now, but terrible- to- non-existent where I am building a house at. So I decided to transfer to VZW towers and bought a highly-recommended phone at WALMART Called the ZTE DUO MAX LTE.
I cannot for the life of me figure out how to enable smart gestures-- basically on the THL5000 I could swipe up to wake up & unlock the phone, or just double tap to wake up the phone (displaying the lock screen. ) -- I have tried a million things and no joy. I even found a few posts on this very forum saying I needed to buy the NovaPrime Launcher and that would enable gestures. I spent the $5 bucks, and it does enable gestures, but only after the phone is awake and unlocked! Nothing will awaken it when the screen is off, which I highly highly prefer to pushing the power button every time. Now I don't care if I have to slide or swipe or tap, but one of them should do it, if possible. ?...
Is there anyway I can do this? If not, I want to hurry and get the app refund because I spent the money in the launcher specifically for this purpose. ... if not going to happen, I have no use for it lol. Ok any help would be very greatly appreciated!

Anybody- -- ?
I guess you can't cross post, I tried posting this in the ZTE forum but it disappeared. I am thinking this is an Android 5.0 issue rather than a ZTE issue -- anything I can do here?
Thanks much, could use the help.

Smart gestures are typically added by the manufacturer--they aren't a native feature of Android. Presumably, your ZTE phone doesn't have this feature.
You could try an app like KnockOn (or one of the similar apps listed in the Google Play Store), but keep in mind that adding this kind of feature to a phone that wasn't designed to do it can increase battery drain (since the phone is essentially remaining awake in order to sense your finger tapping the screen).
Another Mod may have deleted your duplicate post in the ZTE forum, since we try to avoid having multiple duplicate posts in different forums. It makes more sense for this post to be in the ZTE forum than the Lollipop forum, though, so I'll move it there.

Thanks for the help.
moving it here definitely attracted the help I was looking for.

Welcome to Android Central! It's probably not a screen calibration issue. Try booting into Safe Mode, which temporarily disables all 3rd party apps. On most Android devices, while powered on, press and hold Power until the Power Off menu appears. Press and hold the Power Off selection until the Safe Mode prompt appears. Tap OK.
If the problem disappears in Safe Mode, then something you installed is causing the problem. You may have to uninstall apps one by one until the problem disappears. If the problem persists in Safe Mode, then it's more likely to be a hardware or firmware problem.

Welcome to Android Central! Which phone? Is there an option for Manual Time/Date at all? Are you saying that Automatic Time/Date is actually selected, or is it greyed out and you can't select it?

Hi B. Diddy,
Thank you for welcoming me, very kind.
The phone is an old ZTE, N861.
Yes, there is an option for manual date and time but only when you disable the automatic date and time.
You see, once you enable automatic, then the manual will be greyed out. Similarly, once you disable automatic, the manual will become active. It's logical.
The option for automatic date and time is already selected AND greyed out, as if it's a one-time choice for ever. That's not logical.
I formatted the phone, and the automatic date and time seems to be already selected... as if it's the default option... and there is no way to disable it.
And since it is selected and greyed out, everything else is also greyed out, including the manual date, the manual time, as well as the daylight savings time. The only things open for editing are the choice of the 12-hour versus 24-hour system, as well as the date format (i.e. choice of day/month/year permutation sequence).
That's odd. Try going to Settings>Security>Device Administrators, and see if anything is listed and checked there besides Android Device Manager. Also try ​Settings>Security>Clear Credentials.

title: How do I restore calendar notes and appointments?

thread.text: I had to do a factory reset on my ZTE Max phone, I obviously lost important data like Dr appointments from my calendar, how do I restore my calendar to previous dates

Welcome to Android Central! Were all of those events saved to your Google Calendar account, or to the Device Calendar? If you save it to Google, the event gets synced to your Google account in the cloud immediately, which means they should sync back to the phone after a hard reset, once you log back in with your Google account. But if you saved them to the Device Calendar instead, that doesn't sync anywhere automatically. If you didn't back up the events manually, then the factory reset wiped them out. I always strongly recommend that people save calendar events and contacts to their Google account, and not the local Device account, for just this reason.

title: Can someone give a tutorial on replacing the sim on the ZTE Grand max+ Z987?

thread.text: Recently I purchased a ZTE Grand Max+. model number Z987. It came from Ebay without a sim card and when I began looking for the place the sim card would eventually go I couldn't find it. That is because the phone does not open and there are 2 slots on the side of this device which are made to hold the sim card and the SD card. The little doors/slots are not easy to remove even with the little tool which is provided. But what is worse is it is almost impossible to get the sim card , which is placed in the little drawer made to hold it, to push back into the slot. In fact I was not successful at completing this part so I took it into a Cricket store where the clerk proceeded to jam it back into the slot. What gives with this and are there any 'tricks' to getting the sim and SD card to go back into their slots on the side of this phone and what happens when the battery wears out since the phone doesn't open?

Make sure the SD card is fully seated in the drawer - if it's not it'll jam inside and the drawer won't open. (And make sure it's the right size - it takes a microSIM.)
As for the battery, it can be replaced by a shop, but if you don't discharge it below 40%, you'll probably want to replace the phone before the battery goes bad.

thread.text: I need more,storage space in my phone and,want to uninstall the YouTube AP
Welcome to Android Central! Did it come preinstalled? If so, you can't uninstall it unless you root the phone.

YouTube is normally a installed app since it's a google app. Most devices will let you disable the app but not uninstall it. To check to see if you can disable it, long press the app icon and drag to top of screen to hover over app info, then release finger. This will open the app info in application manager. 
If you are wanting to uninstall for my storage price, keep in mind 95% preloaded apps are saved in the system partition of the memory so no space will be gained besides for updates that will save to the user side of memory.

title: ZTE Maven was reset. ATT not a Go-Phone. How can I get it working again?

thread.text: This is a go phone but I am using it on contract -- I signed I. With Google to set up but realized I did not want them connected. Did a factory reset and now my device is saying sign in with previous Google acct and just keeps going to sign even though correct info put in. I checked from my Google account on desktop and reset everything there so what do I need to do

Welcome to Android Central! If you logged in with your Google account, then did a factory reset without removing that account first, it's considered an "unauthorized" factory reset, and requires you to enter the same Google account name and password after the reset. This is Google's new factory reset protection feature. Are you certain you're entering the correct information? Are you able to log into that Google account on your computer using the same password? Is 2-step authentication turned on for your account? If so, turn it off temporarily.
I changed my password prior to resetting it, could this be why is wont accept my google account? Is there anything else I can do?

If you changed your Google password on the web, then you typically have to wait 72 hours before resetting your device.https://support.google.com/nexus/ans...72890?hl=en-GBDon't Change Your Google Password Before Factory Resetting Your Android Phone - You Might Trip A 72-Hour Security Lockout
How can I remove the google account from the phone without deleting and closing the google account altogether?
Go to Settings>Accounts-Google, select the Google account, tap Menu>Remove Account.

title: How can I stop data usage when I'm connected to Wifi on a Zte Zinger phone?

thread.text: Hi. I got a Zte Zinger phone when I came into the Solavei carrier but the carrier's no longer working so I'm being switched to T-Mobile which is the company that gave antenna and phone access to Solavei. I'm completely new to smartphones and only know the most basic use, meaning making phonecalls, texting, searching the web and using apps but nothing else. I don't even have a data plan on the phone currently since I was using free wifi but have to get it now since I'm moving to Florida and, at least until I know my way around and know where I can find free wifi access, have to rely on the data to look at Google maps to find my way. I need to know how to stop data usage by my apps when I'm not using it and how to put wifi as my prioty over data so that I use it as little as possible given that my plan is only 500MG a month and don't want to waste it unnecesarily. Any other information you have would also be of great help Thanks everyone

Welcome to Android Central! When wi-fi is connected, the phone is supposed to favor wi-fi over mobile data. But it will also use mobile data for things that it can't do over wi-fi (primarily MMS, which is picture texting).
If you want to be sure, you can toggle off mobile data yourself. If the phone doesn't have a mobile data toggle in the Quick Settings (swipe down from the top of the screen with two fingers), then go to Settings>Data Usage or Settings>Mobile Networks and look for the option to turn mobile data on or off. There are a number of mobile data toggle widgets you can also install from Google Play Store, but for most phones, this only takes you to the appropriate system settings menu, where you have to manually toggle the actual mobile data setting.

title: ZTE 755 Cricket storage is low, what settings can I set up to not use up all of my plans GBs?

Welcome to Android Central! To be clear--you're concerned about the data usage, not internal storage running low, correct? They're two different things.
Go to Settings>Data Usage to see what apps are using the most data. For some apps, you can go to their menus and look for a Data Refresh or Sync option, and set it to Manual (or the longest interval possible). For apps that don't give you this option, you can select the app in the Data Usage menu and tap Restrict Background Data (or you can universally Restrict Background Data, but this might make you miss things like important app notifications).
This guide might be generally useful for you: http://forums.androidcentral.com/gen...-lollipop.html

Posted via Android Central App

Most built in apps can be disabled by opening your app drawer and long pressing on the app icon, and then dragging the icon to where it says "app info" at the top of the screen. Depending on which app you may or may not be able to disable it. Note that disabling the app will make it as if the app is no longer installed. In order to restore a disabled app just go to settings/apps/disabled and you can re enable them from there.

title: ZTE Z740/AT&T Radiant music on SD

thread.text:
I'm having an issue with my Z740/radiant where it plays music fine from internal memory, but it won't from the SD card. I've used both the default music app ("Music") and Jetaudio Basic, and neither finds any music files on the SD card. Jet Audio doesn't even appear to see the card when I click on the file tab in the app. The default player doesn't appear to have a folder icon I can click on in the app to browse for files.
The files are visible from a file manager app I have. I can click on the files from the file manager and bring up the default music player (choosing from the list of apps that pops up), and the file plays. If I try to do the same thing with JetAudio, the app briefly comes up, but bounces back to the file manager before playback starts.
I tried to clear the app data for both apps to force music rescan, and that didn't help.
This SD card appears to play well with the phone in other respects. Apps run from it fine. Is there a way to evaluate that further?
Unfortunately, this phone has such limited internal memory to start with that it is basically useless as an audio player unless I can get the SD card to work for audio. 
EDIT: This phone has Android 4.2.1.

Made some progress tonight after much searching and tinkering. First, I found that I had a .nomedia file in the root directory of my sd card. Before making changes, I unmounted it, backed it up to my desktop via a card reader, deleted that file, and remounted it. After that, all three audio player apps on the phone would play audio files selected using the file manager. (Not sure if that was due to deleting .nomedia or just unmounting/mounting the card - maybe the latter is more likely). However, I still couldn't see any files in the library of any of the three players. 
JetAudioBasic has an option to rebuild the library from a specified directory. From there, I was able to see and specify the music folder on the sd card. It appeared to be thinking about doing something when I clicked OK, but no new files appeared in the library.
Then I downloaded an sd card scanner app. It scanned the card, and I could see it listing some of the audio files as it showed scanning progress. But no new audio files appeared in any of the libraries. 
Finally, not knowing what else to do, I just downloaded a new audio player, PowerAmp (free trial version). It found all my audio files, on both internal memory and sd card. Everything plays fine. 
I'm still wondering why this happened. And I'm curious as to whether it will happen again if I sync more music to the card (maybe the new music won't show up). I'll try that later in the week and see what happens....

I can see I'm just having a conversation with myself here, but I'll keep going in case it helps someone else. 
Last night I synced a couple more albums of mp3s to the sd card. They showed up in the new PowerAmp app right away, as well as the two pre-existing audio players on the phone. But only those two albums are showing up on the pre-existing apps. Now I suspect that I could delete and re-sync the missing audio files and they would then show up. However, everything plays nicely in PowerAmp, so I'm not going to worry about it for now. Maybe when the free PowerAmp trial runs out in a couple weeks....

If the problem disappears in Safe Mode, then something you installed is causing the problem. You may have to uninstall apps one by one until the problem disappears. If the problem persists in Safe Mode, then it's more likely to be a hardware or firmware problem.

title: Why does the screen of my ZTE Valet flash on and off while on a call?

thread.text: With the screen flashing on and off I can't access the keypad to enter anything or end a call. When I shine my flashlight on the proximity sensor it works right.

You've hit the preverbal nail on the head with the flashlight thing. Chance are your sensor is dirty, it may not look too bad but these sensors are sensitive and sometimes it only takes a little bit of grim, from makeup, sweat, or your pocket to cause it to act up. Do you have a screen protector on the device that also covers the sensor? Screen protectors are natorious for turning colors, brown, yellow, etc., and just being able to see through the protector doesn't garantee that it can see you back. If you have a screen protector that you can remove just the bit that covers the sensor try that, clean the face of the phone up real well including the sensor, or remove the cover your screen protector is attached to and see if that doesn't put function back into your device. I will also add that these sensors don't usually go bad, but when they do usually fail on or off, so they either think they are seeing light when they are not or they never see the light, I think I know a few people like that, but anyway by shining a light at it and it working shows that something is blocking the light dark signal and the sensor is working. If you are thinking of an app to check the sensor there are some, as well as codes you can put into the device to activate a self diagnostic, but if your sensor is dirty or otherwise inhibited they won't really diagnose the issue unless you've done the minimum.

I was able to look at the sensor under a microscope at work and saw it was dirty under the screen on the inside. Spraying compressed air into the speaker by the sensor cleared away what was interfering with the sensor. Works great now.

title: Rooted and partitioned my ZTE Midnight but still running out of space.

replies.text:
Unfortunately the only solution (aside from further repartitioning the SD card) is to delete those apps to clear space, and/or find alternatives to those apps. 
Other short term fixes is to periodically go through and clear cache of the top apps consuming the most storage. Go into system settings > applications > sort by size. Click on the few top apps and clear cache. Again, this is only a temporary fix, as you'll once again be back to the limit as cache starts to rebuild.

title: ZTE Valet TracFone

thread.text: I am thinking about purchasing the ZTE Valet Tracfone but have a few questions. I just don't understand this data concept. If I buy a years contract I get 1200 mobile phone minutes, 1200 texts, and 1200mb of data. What I don't understand is: When does my data allotment get tapped? If I connect to the web using mobile web do my mobile minutes get deducted as long as I am connected? What gets deducted from the data allotment in this situation? Do I get one byte deducted for each byte sent and each byte received? If that's the case how long will the data allotment last? Would it be better if I only connected using wifi? What about GPS. Does anything get deducted when I use this feature? There is nothing anywhere I can find that explains any of this. Its like they start out assuming you already know a lot of basic stuff... HELP.

Welcome to Android Central! I assume that you mean you get 1200 of each of those items per month, correct?
Mobile phone minutes refer only to calls you make. The 1200 mb of data is when you're connected to 3G or 4G and sending or receiving data. Remember that you don't have to be actively doing anything to have your phone use data, since it is often doing some background syncing and updating. If you use wifi to connect to the web, then your mobile data connection should turn off temporarily, thus preventing you from using up more of your data allotment, but this doesn't always happen depending on the phone. In this situation, it is often a good idea to turn off your 3G/4G connection while on wifi to ensure that you're not using up your mobile data.
1.2 GB of data per month is fairly average for the moderate user. If you plan on streaming a lot of music or videos while not on a wifi connection, then you might need more.
GPS itself does not use mobile data, but apps that use the GPS can use mobile data (like, for example, Google Maps). GPS isn't entirely necessary unless you need a precise location--without GPS, the phone can triangulate your position within reasonable accuracy (say, around 1000 feet) using the cell towers or the wifi address.
Please be aware that the ZTE Valet is very much an entry-level phone. Its specs (ZTE Valet Specs, Features (Phone Scoop)) say that it has 512 MB of system RAM, which is pretty low these days (most phones have at least 1 GB, and high end phones have 2 GB). Low RAM means fewer apps can stay in memory, which means more sluggish performance and app switching. It also only has 4 GB of onboard storage ROM, of which only 2.3 GB is available to you. This storage ROM is the only area where you can install apps, so it will limit how many apps you can install, and how big they are. Inserting an external microSD card will not allow you to install more apps--it's mainly good for storing media files, like music, photos, videos, etc. If you can afford it, and if these things are important to you, I would suggest finding a phone with at least 1 GB of RAM and 8 GB of storage ROM.
Good luck!

The GPS app that I am thinking about is a golf app that tells you where you are in distance from the pin on a given golf course. I assume the app is running all the time and tracking my location. I don't know how much data that will use. I guess I'll find out.
Realistically, the data a GPS-related app uses will still be relatively low. It's nowhere near the data you may use if you watch a lot of YouTube videos, for example.

title: ZTE Valet: Can You Post the Pictures and Videos It Takes?

thread.text:
I simply cannot afford the monthly contract fees associated with having an iPhone or first-rate Android phone. The ZTE Valet Android phone came out in the last month or two solely for Tracfone, a pay-as-you-go phone company. I am already a Tracfone customer and it sounds like the perfect upgrade for me. 
I just want to know whether Social Media apps like GifBoom, Vine, Instagram, Foursquare, Twitter and Facebook will really, truly work on this phone and the 3G Verizon network that Tracfone uses. I understand that they may crash sometimes, may be a little slow and that I may be able to have only one app open at a time. I just want to know whether I will be able to post the pictures and videos I take with its camera. 
Does anyone have any comments or advice for me? 
Sent from my Nexus 7 using AC Forums mobile app.

I just bought the zte it is a nice phone
I am not quite out in the middle of nowhere but the carrier is Verizon and its a bit weak.
I'll give you a heads up...
Its full Android
There are no Tracfone Aps to add time or check your time or renew date so you have to do that by phone or on their website.. I expect they will make one soon since they do have such an app for the other company StraightTalk so probably in a few months.
It is slow but it could be my connectivity
You can not reverse tether as far as i have found to allow your phone to use your computer for internet over the USB Cable or over Bluetooth so i am buying a cheap refurbished wifi router to plug into my cable modem.
Gmail works fine over verizon.. 
I downloaded one app so far it was AVG Anti Virus .. i suggest you get that its free .. put it on first thing it will scan your email and web and even your textsmsgs can corrupt your phone so avg catches all that.. hopefully
You will need a video player if you download videos in MP4 .. there are free players 
The camera works fine its HD and you can take a pic every 2 seconds or less 
I am updating the memory card .. there are a few good deals on Amazon for 32gb micro sd but make sure it says Class 10 .. the phone comes with a 4gb class 4 card which is fine but you don't want to install a bunch of apps and then change out for a new one or you can have problems .. so if you are getting one get it early.. 
Setup ... 
You get the phone
Call Tracfone and go through the automated setup.
The red card has your serial number and also you must call a special number.
Activation took about 3 hours at home
I have attempted to make a few videos but .. they are good quality I guess .. not like HD TV but they are fine.
All in all its a Great Deal
I got the ZTE .. it has the 3.2mb camera 
There are Two other phones.. 
One is primarily distributed at Walmart Stores Cant remember the name but it starts witha H hawiai or something.
Very slightly better specs on some things.. 
but the ZTE has newer Android...
So in total ... its a great phone.
Use the WIFI Feature so you don't need to use your minutes.. 
You can even Wifi from many stores and make calls over GoogleTalk and there is a app for that on the phone
I got it... I like it.. its not a Samsung S4 .. but its a billion times better than any non android tracfone.

replies.text: Can you upload to facebook

I went ahead and bought the phone and it is GREAT! It does just about everything that my Nexus 7 Android Tablet does. Yes, it uploads to Facebook and to almost everywhere else. GifBoom, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Foursquare, My Tracks and MapMyWalk all work.
Of the apps I've tried, I have a problem with Vine and QR & Bar Code Scanner only. The Vine app does not yet support recording on the ZTE Valet. That is what a message says when I try to record. I haven't gotten a response from Vine, but I am presuming that that is temporary. The message does say "yet". 
The QR & Bar Code app does not scan. I think that the problem is that the camera cannot focus on something that close. The image looks blurred to the eye. I've tried a second similar app and it doesn't scan either. If you read the reviews of these scanner apps, not everyone can get them all working on every device. I suppose it could be a matter of finding the right scanner app for the ZTE Valet, but I doubt it.
I recommend this phone. 
Sent from my Nexus 7 using AC Forums mobile app

I downloaded the pic2shop app and I was able to scan a few bar codes with my ZTE Valet. If it doesn't scan, you can type in the bar code number.Strange, when I transferred my 2,430 minutes on my old Tracfone to the ZTE, I received 2,430 in each....Talk, Text, Data.
That's what you should get. In my case, they gave me ~9x of each because of an error on Tracphone's end....not complaining. ;-]

Lucky you, after I transferred my minutes from the old phone, I purchased a year card and received my triple minutes....nice! Haven't tried my data yet, keep it turned off and just use wifi. Not sure how much it will use to check email, etc.

More than you would guess! I mainly use WiFi (need a strong signal I'm finding) but have used mobile data some. When you do try it, Data usage in system settings gives you a graphical display of cumulative use over a time period which you can select/adjust. It also shows below this bar charts of data use by app. For me, mail use- even with mail app set to d/l only headers and no pixs- is 40-50% of Total. Example: from 1/18/14 to 2/6/14, I used about 36.3 MB in about a total of 4 short sessions. 17.8 MB was for e-mail, mainly headers (seems high, only d/ld the full message for a few) and 6.5 MB for the stock browser. I just found out if you tap the bar for each app shown, you can view the app settings and also restrict that app in getting 'background' data and to only use Non-mobile networks if available. Need to try that next time I do mobile data use.
Sent from my AT100 using Tapatalk 2

I don't question a single fact, display or setting that you mention, but my overall impression is exactly the opposite. I am surprised at how much I can do with very little mobile data usage. This is probably because I can't be bothered to look at email when I am away from WiFi. I take lots of pictures that I post to Instagram, Facebook, etc., I check in with Foursquare everywhere I go and upload a picture too and I track my drives in the car and dog walks with 2 other apps. I've barely made a dent in the 2 GB of data that I bought (with a data card). I don't have any quantitative data to support my impression. By the way, I do concur that you need a strong WiFi signal. 
Sent from my Nexus 7 using AC Forums mobile app
Well that sounds encouraging. I'm starting off with 3.64 GB of data, so I'll have to check my email a few times to see how much I use.

Congratulations on your new phone, but unless I'm looking at the wrong version of the phone online, I'd have to disagree with the guy who sold it to you--the specifications that I can find on the web are decidedly low-to-mid range. Most phones can use the LED flash as a flashlight, and Google Earth is available to install on all devices. Anyway, there are so many Android phones out there that having a dedicated subforum for each one is unfeasible. The decision to create a subforum depends on largely on how popular the phone is, and perhaps on what the phone represents (like, for example, is there some big innovation like a flexible screen, or is it the intended flagship for a company).

I have a phone with 4.0 instead of your 4.1, but I have sent multiple address messages before with the same result. They open in different threads so that you can have separate conversations with each person. This is helpful if you are asking "what are you doing," and you need to have a different conversation with each recipient. 
If you want everyone in the list of recipients to receive all the messages you send though you should consider setting up a Google Hangout with the people you have in mind. This will mean that everyone in the "hangout" will receive each and every message with a note that says who wrote it.

That's odd. Does your phone list only 2 different storage areas (Phone Storage and SD card), or is there a 3rd storage area listed as well? I'm just wondering if there's a separate App Storage partition that is the one almost full (as outlined in that linked guide). On older phones, apps can only be installed in a separate App Storage partition, which may only be 1-2 GB.

There's a separate App storage partition and it's very small.
What I did with mine was root it then use titanium backup to delete a lot of the built in apps and move ones that are not system critical to the 2GB internal memory.
The Rom I flashed it with had Skype/Facebook.etc built in but they were old versions and taking up a lot of room, since it's not my main phone I just removed them completely.
Be very careful moving/deleting stuff with titanium (Or similar util) as it will probably let you move delete Critical applications that the phone needs to work (I.e don't delete/move the dialler, google frameworks.etc)

Apparently, the handset has a divided memory internal storage & phone storage. The second is virtually all available while the first, in contrast, is almost all occupied.
When you want to upgrade (or install new apps) where's it going (?), Which seems to internal memory. So the space is short. In my view (and I do not understand almost nothing of it, that's why I asked for help) if I could merge the "internal memory" to "phone memory" into one where the apps were this would solve the problem. But, how?
Anyway it seems to me too complex, moreover because I have difficulty with specific technical terminology.
I am very thankful to you, this my first incursion into these areas (perhaps the last, too).
thank you

The partitioning of the storage memory is a limitation of older phones. Unfortunately, there's no way for you to merge those areas together. Newer phones have "unified" storage, so that you have the entire onboard storage memory available to install apps. The main downside is that you can't mount the phone via USB as an external hard drive to your computer--you can only connect using Media Transfer Protocol (MTP), which doesn't show you every single folder that is on your phone.
Don't let this put you off Android--the best way to experience it is to get a decent phone that's considered at least midrange in performance. Entry level phones are typically underpowered, outdated, and of generally poor build, so it's unfortunate that people may end up getting a bad impression of the actual Android software due to the hardware limitations.

I realized that the problem has no solution in itself and it would be best, as soon as possible, get another smartphone with larger, and better capabilities
I think I'll be back one day...

title: The Vine App and the ZTE Valet.

thread.text:
The ZTE Valet (Z665C) Android phone running Jelly Bean 4.1 has been out for 2 to 3 months now, but the Vine app still does not yet support recording video on it. Every other camera-related app that I have downloaded is able to find and use the camera to suit its purposes, with the exception of QR Code and the First Community Credit Union check scanning app. The problem with those apps is not in finding the camera, but in focusing it. Since the ZTE Valet has only a single rear facing camera, it cannot focus clearly on something as close to the lens as a check or a QR code. However, Viddy, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Foursquare, MapMyWalk, GifBoom and GIF Camera have no problems.
What's up with Vine? I'd like to believe that it is just a question of an update and the problem with Vine will be solved. Would that suggest that the developers of the other apps I mentioned were more forward thinking than the Vine developers and sort of pre-updated their apps before the introduction of the ZTE Valet? Or does it suggest that MOST apps don't require an update to deal with a new camera phone on the market, but that Vine is somehow diffferent aand does reqire that last tweak? Does anyone have any ideas? Maybe it has to do with the pay-as-you-go Tracfone company which provides service for the ZTE Valet.

There were 2 updates of the Vine app yesterday. Perhaps they were related to the arrival of Android Kit Kat; I don't know. In any case, the Vine app on my ZTE Valet Android 4.1 phone now begins initializing when I tap the Record icon. That's as far as it goes, and then, it closes. 
This is real progress. Since I started this Thread, tapping the Record icon brought up a message saying that recording was not supported on this device yet. Now, tapping results in app failure accompanied by an opportunity to report the incident. I've reported the incident to the people at Vine a couple of times and included my thanks for their progress. 
Sent from my Nexus 7 using AC Forums mobile app
